quotes.quote: If being a tall girl is a good thing, it is likely to be because of the advantages that the tall have over the short.
Research does show a modest advantage of taller women.
The only difference is that the Jews are now a group of leggy women, and they meet and compete for a suitor who is supposedly a multi-millionaire.
The modern obsession with tallness -- its perceived association with strength, physical superiority, and moral virtue -- has many roots.
Countless social science surveys have shown that the public uncritically ascribes positive traits to tall people -- more intelligent, more likable, more dependable, and better leaders.
I always assumed the obvious: when you're tall, people don't mess with you.
Yet for society as a whole, there seems to be no advantage whatsoever in people being taller.
But in the real world, where women worked as waitresses, school-teachers, and secretaries, being tall bestowed few benefits.
If a girl was too tall, her chances of finding a suitable mate would be severely compromised.

The tall girl generally is admired by our society, but the girl who grows too tall--six feet or more--finds difficulty buying smart clothes, obtaining certain jobs (airline hostesses) or selecting suitable dance partners.
Everyone knows that being tall has its benefits: greater social and economic prospects, an advantage in mate selection, a better shot of making it as a model.
Studies shows that tall people are automatically considered more intelligent, more attractive and more likable.
Only in a room full of tall people does it become apparent that height is a pivotal piece of identity, that height was the most defining force in our lives.
Being tall, I learned, has meaning far beyond just seeing over people's heads. We share the balancing act of being the chosen people, yet we live in a society that is not built for us.
Being tall has many advantages, it makes you extraordinary.
Because clothes look better in tall people. They hang better, move better, show better.
Tall, slim, blue eyed girl: this is what is seen--what is enforced to be the definition of beauty and utter inspiration.
Many women have said to me that they wish they were as tall as I am. My height in the end turned out to be a big advantage (modeling! volleyball!).
Tall people are jealous of you because while they can't shrink, you can still 'grow.'
Although shorter women faced clear disadvantage in the modelling industry, taller women also endured the problematic of being too tall.
Being tall and having long legs is all fun & games, until you get into the back of a small car.
It is not how tall you are, it is how good you are.
